meanings.definition: Worthy of notice or attention; remarkable.
meanings.sent1: The student's noteworthy achievement was celebrated by the whole school.
meanings.sent2: Her noteworthy talent for painting was evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent3: It was quite noteworthy how the cat managed to open the door all by itself.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted a noteworthy picture in the sky, with hues of orange and pink blending beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The teacher made a noteworthy impact on her students, inspiring them to reach for the stars.

meanings.definition: Deserving of being noted or remembered.
meanings.sent1: The old house had many noteworthy features that caught the eye of passersby.
meanings.sent2: His noteworthy kindness towards others made him a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent3: It was quite noteworthy how the squirrel managed to steal all the nuts from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a noteworthy beacon of light in the midst of a dark room.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was so noteworthy that it stayed in my mind long after it ended.
